availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Scottsville, Kentucky native. Son of Henry Clay Caruth and Mary Mansfield Caruth. Married to Harriet Caruth. Moved to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in 1852. Attended Central High School in Philadelphia. Attended Dickinson College in Carlisle, Pennsylvania. Studied law with James Speed in Louisville in 1861. Graduated from law school at the University of Louisville in Louisville in 1863.

ab.bibl: Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 7, p. 110. The National Cyclopaedia of American Biography, Vol. III, (New York, New York, 1898), pp. 176-77. Find A Grave, "George William Caruth, Sr. (1842-1921)," Memorial #93532825, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=93532825 (accessed July, 7, 20177).
